intro: Meibomia matto-grossensis, commonly known as the Amazonian meibomia, is a flowering plant native to the dense rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic properties. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and drawing moisture and nutrients from the air. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying vibrant colors that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its habitat in remote, biodiverse regions, it remains relatively understudied in botanical research.
